alert.note: Alert for Burnett; Washburn (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL WASHBURN AND NORTHEASTERN BURNETT COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM CDT... At 415 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Webb Lake Wisconsin, or 18 miles northwest of Spooner, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Trego. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northwestern Wisconsin.
